raw_text:
Hewitt survives Nalbandian epic
 
 Home favourite Lleyton Hewitt came through a dramatic five-set battle with Argentine David Nalbandian to reach the Australian Open semi-finals.
 
 Hewitt looked to be cruising to victory after racing into a two-set lead. But Nalbandian broke his serve three times in both of the next two sets to set up a nailbiting decider. Hewitt eventually grabbed the vital break in the 17th game and served out to win 6-3 6-2 1-6 3-6 10-8 and set up a meeting with Andy Roddick. The winner of that match will face either Roger Federer or Marat Safin in the final. Ninth seed Nalbandian had never come back from two sets down to win a match, and there was no indication he would do so as Hewitt dominated the first two sets.
 
 The Argentine had stoked up the temperature ahead of the match by saying Hewitt's exuberant on-court celebrations were "not very good for the sport". And he had words with Hewitt during one change of ends in the second set when the Australian appeared to brush shoulders with him as they went to their chairs. The balance of power changed completely in the third set as Hewitt allowed his level to dip, and he double-faulted twice as Nalbandian broke on the way to taking the fourth set. But the tiring third seed showed incredible reserves of strength to force the break despite being outplayed for much of the final set and three times coming within two points of defeat. He then produced a love service game to finish off the match in four hours and five minutes. "I just kept hanging in there. It was always tough serving second in the fifth set," said Hewitt, who had never reached the last four at his home Grand Slam. "I told myself to give everything and in the end it paid off once again. "It's a long way from holding that trophy up there but I'm hanging in there. "Only four guys left that can win and we're the top four in the world. It's set up for a pretty good showdown in the semis and finals."
llama3.2:1b: Lleyton Hewitt survives David Nalbandian to reach Australian Open semi-finals, winning 6-3 6-2 1-6 3-6 10-8.
The match was a dramatic five-set battle with Nalbandian breaking his serve three times in each of the next two sets.
llama3.2:3b: Lleyton Hewitt defeated David Nalbandian 6-3 6-2 1-6 3-6 10-8 to reach Australian Open semi-finals, overcoming a two-set deficit in the final set after trailing by two points with three service games left.
gemma2:2b: Lleyton Hewitt defeated David Nalbandian in a five-set match to advance to the Australian Open semifinals.
Hewitt had a 2-0 lead early on, but Nalbandian won three consecutive breaks in the next two sets to force a decider.
Hewitt broke serve for the final time in the 17th game and won in the fifth set with an 8-10 tiebreaker score.
He will face Andy Roddick in the semifinals.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A home favourite Australian player Hewitt defeated Argentine David Nalbandian in the semi-finals of the Australian Open, where he eventually reached the final against Roger Federer or Marat Safin.
He dominated the first two sets but allowed his level to dip despite outplaying Nalbandian for much of the match.

Despite being outplayed and coming close to giving up, Hewitt showed incredible reserves to finish off the game in just 4 hours and 5 minutes, securing the top spot in the world rankings as he struggled in the final against Roger Federer.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Lleyton Hewitt defeated David Nalbandian in five sets at the Australian Open to reach the semi-finals, with Nalbandian previously never winning after being down two sets.
Hewitt's victory was marked by moments of tension but ultimately came through his determination and resilience.
He faces Andy Roddick for a spot in the final, where Roger Federer or Marat Safin could potentially join him as semifinalists.
qwen2.5:3b: Home favourite Lleyton Hewitt survived an epic five-set battle with Argentine David Nalbandian to reach the Australian Open semi-finals.
Despite initially racing into a two-set lead, Nalbandian broke serve three times in both of the next sets setting up a tense decider.
Hewitt eventually won 10-8 after allowing his level to dip slightly, particularly during the third set where he double-faulted twice and was outplayed for much of the final set.
Ninth seed Nalbandian had never come back from two-set deficits before.
Hewitt praised himself for hanging in there and giving everything, with only Federer and Safin left capable of winning.
opencoder:1.5b: Hewitt survived the Nalbandian epic match.
Hewitt came to victory after racing into a two-set lead, but Nalbandian broke his serve three times.
He eventually grabbed the vital break in the 17th game and served out to win 6-3 6-2 1-6 3-6 10-8.
The winner of that match will face either Roger Federer or Marat Safin in the final.
Nalbandian's first two sets have been down since he won a match, no indication has been made to bring him back in future sets.
smollm:1.7b: Hewitt survived Nalbandian epic by dominating the first two sets, but his performance was marred by his lack of consistency in the third set.
Despite this, he managed to overcome his weaknesses and produce a thrilling second-set match that ended in a 6-3 victory over Nalbandian.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Lleyton Hewitt defeated David Nalbandian in a five-set match at the Australian Open, crucially securing his spot in the semi-finals with a two-set lead that made Nalbandian's approach to victory nearly impossible.
Nalbandian dominated early sets, including three breaks in two critical games, setting up a nailbiting final game where he managed to serve out and ultimately win 10-8.
This victory sets up a potential showdown against Andy Roddick in the finals, with Nalbandian known for his unlikely comeback story.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Australian Open semifinal between David Nalbandian and Lleyton Hewiitt was marked by a dramatic five-set battle that ended with a nailbiting decider.
Na lbbandian broke Hewiitt's serve three times in each of the next two sets to force the break in the 17th game, but Hewiitt managed to hold on and secure the vital break in the final set.
The Argentine went on to celebrate with his opponent, but Naibandian had words with him during one change of ends, which may have affected the Australian's confidence going into the match.

Despite losing the third set, Hewiitt managed to finish off the match in four hours and five minutes, making it all the way to the semi-finals and potentially facing Andy Roddick or Marat Safin in the final.

The win cemented Hewiitt's position as one of the top four players in the world, and the Australian Open semi-finals proved that there is still a lot of talent left to be discovered on the Grand Slam circuit.
tinydolphin:1.1b: In the Australian Open semi-final match between Hewitt and Nalbandian, Lleyton Hewitt displayed exceptional skill and determination to overcome the powerful Argentine player David Nalbandian.
Hewitt's dominance of the first two sets was evident as he remained unyielding in his pursuit of victory.
In the third set, however, Hewitt began to see his game falter, ultimately losing a vital breakpoint during a key change of ends.
This allowed Nalbandian to regain his composure and dominate the fourth set, eventually forcing a deciding fifth set.
Despite facing significant pressure throughout the match, Hewitt remained focused on securing victory and continued to push Nalbandian back in their nail-biting encounter.
As the match drew to a close, Hewitt delivered an exemplary display of sportsmanship by allowing his opponent to break serve twice during crucial moments of the third set.
This decision allowed Hewitt to maintain his momentum and ultimately propel him to victory, setting up a clash with Andy Roddick in the semi-finals.

In the final set, Hewitt came through with an epic comeback, serving out to win 6-3, 6-2, 1-6, 3-6, and 10-8.
The winner of this match will face either Andy Roddick or Roger Federer in the final.
Ninth seed Nalbandian had never come back from two sets down to win a match.
Hewitt's exuberant on-court celebrations were criticized by his opponent.

hermes3:3b: Hewitt beat Nalbandian in an intense 5-set match to reach Australian Open semi-finals, despite initially leading by two sets.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Lleyton Hewitt defeated Argentine David Nalbandian in a dramatic five-set battle to reach the Australian Open semi-finals.
After winning the first two sets, Nalbandian came back to tie 6-6, setting up a decisive fifth set.
Hewitt ultimately won the match with a score of 6-3, 6-2, 1-6, 3-6, 10-8.
He will face Andy Roddick in the next round, with the winner facing either Roger Federer or Marat Safin in the final.

Despite the intense competition, Hewitt remained confident, stating that only the top four players can win the tournament and emphasizing the anticipation for a thrilling showdown in the semis and finals.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Lleyton Hewitt won a dramatic five-set match against David Nalbandian to reach the Australian Open semi-finals.
Hewitt dominated the first two sets, but Nalbandian fought back to level the match.
In a tense final set, Hewitt secured a crucial break in the 17th game and served out the match, winning 6-3 6-2 1-6 3-6 10-8.
The match lasted over four hours, with Hewitt showing resilience despite struggling in the later stages.
Nalbandian had criticized Hewitt's on-court celebrations before the match, and tensions flared during play.
Hewitt, reaching his first Australian Open semi-final, will face Andy Roddick, with the winner set to meet either Roger Federer or Marat Safin in the final.
stablelm2:1.6b: Lleyton Hewitt advanced to the Australian Open semi-finals after defeating Argentine David Nalbandian in a thrilling five-set match.
Despite leading 2-0, Nalbandian broke Hewitt's serve three times in the next two sets, making it an intense decider.
Hewitt secured the win with a vital break in the 13th game and served out at 6-3, 6.
Nalbandian had never come back from two sets down to win a match before this encounter, while Hewitt had previously dominated the first two sets.
However, Nalbandian played exceptionally well in the third set, giving Hewitt a run for his money.
The tension was particularly palpable in the third and final set when Hewitt allowed himself to drop a level, double-faulting twice as Nalbandian broke on the way to winning the fourth set.
However, Nalbandian showed great determination by forcing a break despite being outplayed for much of the final set.
Nalbandian produced a love service game in the last moments of the match to secure victory after four hours and 51 minutes.
Hewitt said he was determined throughout and credited his opponent's incredible strength as a significant factor.
The Australian Open saw him reach the last four at home for the first time, against tough competition from Nalbandian.
Only four players remain in contention to win the tournament, including top-ranked Federer and Safin, who will face Hewitt and Roddick respectively in upcoming matches.
The forthcoming semi-final showdown is anticipated to be an intense battle.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Lleyton Hewitt, the home favorite at the Australian Open, overcame an Argentine opponent, David Nalbandian, in a five-set, four-hour and fifty-minute match.
Despite leading 2-0 after the first two sets, Hewitt faced significant challenges as Nalbandian broke his serve three times in each of the next two sets.
Hewitt ultimately clinched victory in the fifth set with a crucial break, winning 6-3, 6-2, 1-6, 3-6, and 10-8.
This result sets up a semi-final showdown against Andy Roddick, who will face either Roger Federer or Marat Safin in the final.
Nalbandian, known for his intense on-court celebrations, had never overcome a two-set deficit before.
During their match, he and Hewitt engaged in a heated exchange during one change of ends in the second set.
Despite being tired and outplayed in the final set, Nalbandian demonstrated remarkable resilience, forcing several break points against Hewitt.
